description: SSH Git sync fails: Auth fail [preauth]
fix:
Add support for multiple authentication methods by offering password authentication after public key authentication.

Along the way, refactor GitOperation to use a (somewhat) proper builder
pattern. This uncovered that we were previously not using SSHJ for the
case of no authentication, which is now rectified.

description: Improve error message when google sign on fails because of no internet connection
fix:
In the case of email, the message is "Unable to login to your sync account, sorry. Please try again later". In the case of google sign in, the message is "Unable to launch Google sign in."

This PR just modifies that message to a more specific message "No network connection detected. Please try again later.".

description:
It looks like KP2A has a way to differentiate between an app's username and password fields.
Therefore, it should be possible to know what field (from an app that requires an input) the user calls KP2A from.
My idea is that if the user wants, he/she can tell KP2A that the field corresponds to TOTP and have it filled directly next time.
Ideally, the user could specify in KP2A to use TOTP or any other field if he/she wants for that specific call to Autofill but it might be harder to implement I think.
fix: move TOTP button on keyboard to third position (after User/Pwd) and disable TOTP "internal fields" as it now shows up the entry notificaton (unless disabled) and solves the underlying issue in the best found way

description: Crash when adding hotmail.com account

SpecialLocalFoldersCreator created the local outbox folder with a server_id value of "Outbox" instead of "K9MAIL_INTERNAL_OUTBOX". This leads to a conflict when the server contains a folder with the server ID "Outbox" 😢

The proper fix is to not use the server_id column for local folders at all. Unfortunately, this requires changes in a lot of places.

description: Facebook login fails logging in to Facebook from an embedded browser

Approach
According to #1163 (comment):

Set upper range for FB Login SDK to >=13.1.0 <14.0.0 in this PR
Merge this PR with a major version increase, as it may be a breaking change. The FB Login SDK is currently added as api, so it can transitively accessed if the developer adds the Parse SDK also as api to their app. Since the FB SDK has some braking changes with 13.x, we need to consider that also a breaking change for the Parse SDK.

https://support.sectigo.com/articles/Knowledge/Sectigo-AddTrust-External-CA-Root-Expiring-May-30-2020

description: When a user navigates away from the Change Email Address screen while /user/change_email request is in progress, HTTP failed error is received and the new email address is not reflected in the app even though it gets changed on the server. It is not updated even after a forced refresh. The only way to see the new email is to log out and log in with the new email.
fix: I moved the disposables.clear() in the onCleared() viewmodel to the doFinally { } in the changeEmail() function. Clear composite disposables in the onCleared() inflict the http request canceled by the client upon ChangeEmailFragment destroyed, since the http request already sent and being processed by server with http canceled by client we lost our response and can't update email in the AccountManager. By moving disposables.clear() to the doFinally{} we ensure that the http call not canceled when we navigate from the ChangeEmailFragment and the disposable cleared upon request finished.
Root Causes: Lack of Necessary State or Stage

description: Crash in login discovery view
fix: This PR fixes a crash currently happening in 4.1-rc-1 caused by the dark mode product. The Login Discovery Error view was missed during the first round of changes and since it's difficult to get it to be shown, it wasn't failing during testing. The bug is the duplicated +id/toolbar ID assigned in fragment_login_discovery_error.xml layout. When the login library was updated, the toolbar was placed inside an AppBarLayout so using that ID in the <include/> element was erroneously attempting to assign that id to an AppBarLayout instead of a Toolbar and that was causing the crash.

description: Enforce mandatory verification only for new logins
fix:
Creates AppMigration base interface as a way to isolate migration logic, app migrations must implement this interface.
Creates AppMigration01 with the existing logs removal migration and AppMigration02 with the logic to allow existing sessions to skip verification.
Add DefaultSessionPreferencesStoreFactory.remove(sessionId) to allow a ephemeral session store access to exist outside the SessionScope for this new migration.
Root Causes: Lack of Necessary State or Stage

description: Login with given site uses that site for wp.com flow
fix:
I am not sure that this fixes the crash, but it may be. This, for sure, fixes another bug, though. The issue comes from the fact that the site URL stored in the app prefs is not deleted in some cases, and that's why the entered URL used later on is the "current site" URL, which leads to the different broken states.

To reproduce the bug

Open a clean app
Log in -> Enter a non WP.com site
Go back to the main screen
Create a new store -> login
Enter wp.com email
Notice that "it looks like is connected to a different wp.com account" error
My not proven theory is that in some cases, if the site entered on step 2 matches the wpcom account, but somehow not wpcom then JP activation flow started and crash happens, because URL from another site is used that we don't have credentials

description: Redirect to account mismatch error during site credentials when needed
fix:
This PR fixes the above issue by making sure we show the account mismatch screen when connecting using site-credentials to a site that has Jetpack connected to a different account.

The message was updated to reflect that it's not an account mismatch per se, but it's the fact that the used credentials are for an account that's not connected to Jetpack.
The screen doesn't allow much now, but it will be improved in upcoming PRs, and it's still better than the misleading "Jetpack Required" screen that we were using before.

description: SSLHandshakeException after update to Android 7.0
fix: this is expected. SSL crypto in 7.0 is “broken” because it lacks some widely used elliptic curves. You have to upgrade to 7.1.1 or higher.

description: Unified Login: Google login success but app login does not progress
fix:
There are two different layouts for LoginEmailFragment:

One that has a button to allow the user to login with site credentials (tag: TAG_ALT_LAYOUT)
One that has a button to allow for signing in with Google (tag: TAG).
The issue was that the tags were swapped when creating the instance of LoginEmailFragment so that when the method onGoogleLoginFinished was called we'd attempt to connect to the wrong fragment to call finishLogin().

description: New account setup crashes
fix: Avoid crash when MX lookup returns invalid hostname

description: NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method on a null object reference
fix:
Fixes #3154 by adding a null check when user enters a site address during login. I haven't been able to reproduce the issue but it looks like we set the mSiteAddressInput=null when the fragment is destroyed. So if the onTextChanged is called before the mSiteAddressInput could be initialised again, this crash could potentially happen.

Given that we needn't update the mSiteAddressInput field after the fragment is destroyed, it seemed enough to do just a null check here to ensure that this crash doesn't happen again.

description: RuntimeException: Unable to unbind to service org.wordpress.android.login.LoginWpcomService

description:
We run into a potential race when the device is rotated and the confirmation code is submitted before
the phone verification callbacks reinstate the verification id and related params.
fix:
We preserve the verification id and related state and reinstate it before the callbacks overwrite it.
In addition, we add speculative checks to make sure that verification id and confirmation code are not null.

description: Wallabag Service Not Found - Check URL (in Android App)

description: Jetpack connection is broken for Application Passwords login
fix:
While I couldn't reproduce 10043 consistently like what happened to me on Friday, I found some edge cases where it happens, and my theory is that they are caused by the instability of the https://wordpress.com/jetpack/connect that we use for Application Passwords flow. This PR attempts a way for the user to recover from the error, instead of offering a retry that doesn't help.
The retry logic we have in this screen, allows retrying just the last step, while when this issue occurs, we need to retry the connection step itself, and not just the validation, and this PR does this exactly.

description: Signing in with Multi-factor doesn't work (both Java and Kotlin). After enrolling in MFA with my phone number, I signed out and tried to sign in with EmailPasswordFragment. Entering my email password and clicking "SIGN IN" brought me back to the start of the app instead of showing me the MFA page. No SMS verification code was sent and I wasn't able to sign in.
fix:
This PR should fix the MFA sign in flow.
There are a couple of things going on here:

On the java quickstart: a NullPointerException was being thrown in MultifactorSigninFragment#onViewStateRestored. This PR fixes it by adding a null check.
On the Kotlin quickstart: the onCreateView method was not inflating the layout for MultifactorSignInFragment.
For both languages: The navigation was a bit confusing and was preventing the mfa sign in flow from completing successfully.
Previous flow: EmailPassword -> Mfa (checks if sign in is required) -> (if yes) MfaSignIn -> back to Mfa (the app was not coming back to Mfa)
New flow: EmailPassword -> MfaSignIn -> Mfa
Root Causes: Lack of Necessary State or Stage

Closes: #1187

Approach
Allow to use Facebook SDK dependency v14.1.1

description: App redirects back to MyStore when user clicks on the launcher icon
fix:
This PR updates the launchMode of MainActivity to ensure a new instance is not started when the activity is already at the top of the stack.

This PR doesn't implement an optimal fix as it'd be quite complex and is imo not worth the time at the moment. It seems to me the app misuses theFLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK -> at least I don't see any reason why we'd need this flag in our app.

The ideal fix imo would be to remove the usage of FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK from all the places and rely on the default Android behavior + ensure MainActivity isn't recreated when it's already at the top of the stack.

Either case, this PR only updates the latter part of the code and ensures the MainActivity is not recreated when it's already at the top. This fixes the original issue where the MainActivity used to redirect the user to MyStore screen when it was originally not launched from the OS Launcher but for example from the Login Flow.

description: login popups redirect to the first tab after login:Whenever I lwant to login to a website and the website has one of the other methods like google, GitHub or twitter for login then the browser creates a new tab for me to login. after successful login the tab closes and redirects me to the first tab in my opened tabs list. Even after successful login from the sources the website still asks me to wait for login. everytime I get sent to the first tab instead of the tab that requested that login.
fix: It seems that what caused #879 was that after the tab is automatically closed BrowserChromeClient::onCloseWindow is called and BrowserTabViewModel::closeCurrentTab will then be called but removeCurrentTabFromRepository() uses tabRepository.delete(currentTab) instead of tabRepository.deleteCurrentTabAndSelectSource() (which fixes the issue).

description: Contributions didn't appear after logging in again
fix: The issue was because after logging in again, the previous username key with boolean false is not removed from the continuationStore map, that is why it is returning the empty list. Now I have added a method that will remove and reset the existing key, and it will be called when the list has no items in the User's Contribution.

description: No sync button badge on Android 6
fix: The sync button badge was not showing in marshmallow(I presume it wasn't showing in upper versions, like nougat but I didn't test it). The issue was that the badge drawable was loaded through VectorDrawableCompat but the drawable itself wasn't a vector drawable(it's a simple ShapeDrawable). Reverted to use the ContextCompat.getDrawable() to initialize the normal, non vector badge drawable.

description: Changing foreground app prior to login causes the welcome splash to be re-displayed on top of the form. The use-case for doing this is to reference a password manager; it's pretty minor and easy to work around.

description: Account selector UI that overlays on top of the root UI gets created multiple times, once with every orientation change rotation. Then, I have to tap on the desired account once for each instance, as they disappear one by one, and after the last one, app crashes:
fix: I can't reproduce this, but I know it's happened to me too a few times before. While the stacktrace is the same, I think this is a completely different issue than #549. Basically, our fragments stay alive beyond the activity lifecycle so that we can keep logging the user in even if they rotate the screen. This gets a little messy though because we could be trying to finish the activity while it's in no-man's land between an onDestroy and an onCreate. My guess is that since the phone you mentioned is older and slower, it takes much longer for the activity to recreate and attach itself to our fragments thus increasing the likelihood of a crash. Anyway, hopefully #618 will fix this kind of issue once and for all.
